summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 2020 between a U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) legal assistant and a prosecutor regarding travel arrangements for an international trip to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). The emails detail frustrations over booking refundable flights and coordination issues, and reference several prior domestic trips for victim interviews in Los Angeles and West Palm Beach.

connections.description: M submits travel approval requests to S, who approves them, indicating a supervisor-subordinate or colleague relationship within the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Planned Travel to Stockholm for Interview
events.description: Prosecutor M plans to travel from JFK to Stockholm, Sweden, with a layover in Paris, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation. The trip involves coordination for refundable flights and hotel accommodations.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: The prosecution team traveled to Los Angeles for an interview (or interviews) related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Interview
events.description: The team traveled to Los Angeles for an interview on November 14, 2019.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Interview
events.description: Travel for an interview in West Palm Beach, involving M and another colleague, with a request for a hotel conference room.

events.title: Travel to Los Angeles for Victim Interview
events.description: Travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview in the Epstein investigation, involving M and other colleagues, with a request for a hotel conference room.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Planned travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for approximately three days for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Travel to West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale for Meetings/Interviews
events.description: Travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews related to the Epstein case.

locations: JFK (John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York)
keyFacts: The document reveals active international travel by SDNY prosecutors in early 2020 to Stockholm, Sweden, for an interview related to the Epstein investigation (case 2018R01618).
It references multiple prior domestic trips in 2019 to Los Angeles and West Palm Beach/Fort Lauderdale for victim interviews and meetings in the same investigation.
The email chain highlights logistical challenges and strict requirements for booking fully refundable tickets for international government travel.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative activity by the SDNY in the Epstein case well after Epstein's arrest and death, focusing on witness interviews.
The document identifies internal roles and coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding case-related travel.
